DOC.detailed_description: We propose study efficacy zinc multiple micronutrient supplementation reduce risk infectious disease growth falter among infant young child Tanzania . Infants born HIV-negative woman recruit randomly assign factorial design either zinc , micronutrient ( vitamin C , E , B1 , B2 , niacin , B6 , folate B12 ) , micronutrient plus zinc , placebo give daily . Children follow monthly clinic visit age 6 week 18 month . Data obtain include socioeconomic status , anthropometric data ( weight , length , head circumference , arm anthropometrics ) , dietary intake ( include breastfeed duration frequency ) , hemoglobin , ferritin , blood smear malaria . The primary outcome incidence diarrhea respiratory tract infection . Secondary outcome weight length gain . A subset child test blood concentration vitamin A , E , zinc C-reactive protein . All child receive large periodic dose vitamin A every 6 month per standard care Tanzania .
